result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No contact with witness in this case.

01:17 PM Defendant Brandon K. Shields in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon K. Shields appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State gives bail/bond recommendations. Defendant makes statement. State heard on address on other case. Court orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions. Def. has a court appointed on old case. Court advised def. he may make that request with CC on Monday.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
